name: Wheel of Protected Classes
description:
Whether a housing provider has been operating in Washington, D.C. for 1 year or 20 years, or is a landlord for only a few houses or a large apartment complex, it is crucial to stay up-to-date on the many unique local protections and laws in the District. 

Do you know which of the following traits or characteristics are protected from housing discrimination in Washington, D.C.? 

To play:

  1. Press the "Spin" button in the center of the wheel to start it spinning.
  2. Press the "Stop" red arrow on the right side of the wheel to stop the wheel. The wheel will tell you whether the trait or characteristic you landed on is protected from housing discrimination in DC. 
  3. Repeat steps 2 and 3!

To learn more about the DC Human Rights Act, Source of Income, Status as a Victim of an Intra-Family Offense, Criminal Records Screening, Occupancy Codes, and best practices please click here and enroll today: http://equalrightscenter.litmos.com/online-courses/
